title: CSI sticker
content:
Hi friend  
Help me id the font used on this sticker CSI

Thanks in advance

hernando

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20120623023809im_/http:/typophile.com/files/csi_6437.jpg)
author: hernandomiguel

comments.content:
It's likely that the white line through the letters was added later, and is not part of the font. You could use a number of Techno fonts, such as [Space](http://web.archive.org/web/20120623023809/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/bitstream/space/) just by slanting the letters and adding the white line.

- Mike Yanega

It looks like someone was trying to fake the ESPN logo effect but badly.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20120623023809im_/http:/typophile.com/files/espn_logo_6203.jpg)

ChrisL

Then we went to a dollar store and found hundreds of [Sticker Labels](http://web.archive.org/web/20120623023809/http:/www.emanprinting.com/sticker-printing/Sticker-Labels.php) we could use. You should however, try to find smaller [Wholesale Stickers](http://web.archive.org/web/20120623023809/http:/www.emanprinting.com/sticker-printing/Wholesale-Stickers.php). That way you get more for your money and they'll fit into the squares on the calendar.

Blade Runner Movie Font Regular, available on dafont.com looks right.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20120623023809im_/http:/typophile.com/files/BladeRunner_3864.jpg)
